transcriptText:
WHY YOU SHOULD SWING INDIAN CLUBS

Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion

Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion

Consists of compound movements in multiple planes

Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise

Assists recovery from intense training

Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)

It is fun and you forget you are training.

The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.

Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ HEROIC SPORT | AN ANCIENT SPORT

Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors.

Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ READY TO LEARN MORE?

All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

Best regards from Thierry & Ron

coffee break will hare explore today I've got a guest it's my son so it's gonna show us his three favorite exercise we go to bodyweight exercise a single club exercise and a Kelvin exercise yeah come try so show us the push-ups ten of those and then gonna get up of course and you're gonna grab your pal a vandal and then watch how you don't hit the kettlebell their choice take good space yeah sumon and show us your favourite club exercise over the head boom into the lunge yes switch behind the back around top of the head boom catch into the lunge yes ten of those or five on each legs look straight in front of you true and then favorite callable exercise yes Turkish get up I even pickets Troy trains have been out twice a week usually something like that not always so keen but he does it you know and that's the way with kids you just let them train at the rhythm okay so you're gonna step back with the opposite leg left leg back into the ground turn the foot put the hand close to the knee look at the kettlebell keep the straight arm bring the leg in front of you yes L burn to the ground lay down and now you're gonna push off the bent leg come to your elbow yes on to the hand and now you're gonna bring you can switch the legs around that's it look at the kettlebell really nice straighten up straighten up yeah curl the toes behind you toes and up you go boom down swing and switch sides shrimp press it boom okay left left knee back nice and slow Troy turn the foot put the hand close to the knee keep an eye that's very nice then you're gonna bring the leg in front of you bring it through that's it elbow into the ground keep contact that's it lay down yeah push off that foot there and come over to me that's it straighten the arm switch the legs around it straighten up straighten up nice nice look ahead take it easy and up you go boom run a repetition on each arm and then you call it a day or you repeat five times whatever time you got for a quick little break and feel better thanks DRI enjoy leave us a comment down below

# [Indian clubs, Bodyweight & kettlebell | My favorite exercises](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7x2QgffKnqY)

**Visibility**: Public
**Uploaded by**: [Heroic Sport - Indian clubs workouts](http://www.youtube.com/@HeroicSport)
**Uploaded at**: 2020-07-03T04:30:17-07:00
**Published at**: 2020-07-03T04:30:17-07:00
**Length**: 03:56
**Views**: 1110
**Likes**: 52
**Category**: Sports

## Description

```
☛DISCOUNT CODE FOR 10% OFF YOUR SET OF ADJUSTABLE INDIAN CLUBS PAHLAVANDLE™: gen9
GO TO: https://heroicsport.com/product-category/buy-indian-clubs/

☛DISCOUNT CODE FOR 20% OFF TRAINING VIDEOS: swing101
GO TO: https://heroicsport.com/product-category/indian-clubs-tutorials-beginners/

☛DISCOUNT CODE FOR 10% OFF VIVO BAREFOOT SHOES: AJBARE10
GO TO: https://www.vivobarefoot.com/

WHY YOU SHOULD SWING INDIAN CLUBS
〄 PHYSICAL ASPECTS
Gently mobilizes the shoulders, elbows and wrists and improve range of motion
Strengthens the shoulder girdle and grip ( muscles and connective tissues) in its full range of motion
Consists of compound movements in multiple planes
Provides low impact cardiovascular exercise
Assists recovery from intense training
Improves the 3 pillars of physical literacy (body control , locomotion and object control)
〄 MENTAL ASPECTS
It is fun and you forget you are training.
The rhythmic and repetitive patterns are highly meditative and calm the nervous system, like meditation.
Cross crawl exercises and other challenging moves improve learning capacity and stimulate neurogenesis, the creation of new brain cells.

❂ HEROIC SPORT | AN ANCIENT SPORT 
We have created the Pahlavandle ™ and the Pahlavandle™XL to make it affordable for everyone to discover the benefits of swinging clubs.
Our clubs are easily adjustable, which is a modern twist on the ancient traditional Indian clubs used to train Tamil and Persian warriors. 
Indian clubs were used in Europe and USA for remedial gymnastics in the 18th and 19th century, by pioneers of physiotherapy.

❂ READY TO LEARN MORE?
We run instructor certifications (online and live), team building events and offer video downloads on our website at https://heroicsport.com/indian-clubs-online/
All our educational material has been tested and structured since 2010, in a way that is easy for anyone to learn from home.

❂ FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM https://www.instagram.com/heroic.sport/
Best regards from Thierry & Ron
```

knee look at the kettlebell keep the straight arm bring the leg in front of you yes L burn to the ground lay down and now you're gonna push off the bent leg come to your elbow yes on to the hand and now you're gonna bring you can switch the legs around that's it look at the kettlebell really nice straighten up straighten up yeah curl the toes behind you toes and up you go boom down swing and
